de.brands4friends.daleq.core

Interface DaleqSupport

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DbUnitDaleqSupport

    public interface DaleqSupport
    Provides the Daleq infrastructure to a Unit Test.

    This class is intended to be used in a unit test. If Java would support Mixins, this would be a candidate. But it ain't. Hence a Unit Test can only delegate to this class. Nonetheless, this class is designed to make such a delegation as painless as possible.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void assertTableInDatabase(Table table, FieldDef... ignoreColumns)
      Checks whether the actual table in the database has the same content as the given table.

    • Method Detail

      • insertIntoDatabase

        void insertIntoDatabase(Table... tables)
        Inserts the Tables into the database.

        Once the table content has been defined, the respective TableData is created and inserted into a configured database. The tables are inserted in the order they are given to the method. This has to be considered especially if foreign key constraints must be fulfilled.

        Parameters:
        tables - the Daleq tables, which are should be filled into the database.
        Throws:
        DaleqException - if an error occurred in the underlying infrastructure.

      • cleanInsertIntoDatabase

        void cleanInsertIntoDatabase(Table... tables)
        Deletes the complete content of the given tables in the database and inserts the rows in tables into the database. The tables are inserted according to insertIntoDatabase(Table...).
        Parameters:
        tables - the Daleq tables, which are should be filled into the database.
        Throws:
        DaleqException - if an error occurred in the underlying infrastructure.

      • assertTableInDatabase

        void assertTableInDatabase(Table table,
                         FieldDef... ignoreColumns)
        Checks whether the actual table in the database has the same content as the given table.

        Compares the given table to the content of the table with the same name in the database. Details of the comparison depend on the actual implementation.

        Parameters:
        table - the data in this table is compared to the data in the database.
        ignoreColumns - These fields will be ignored when the table is compared to the database. This is usually used, when you need to ignore values that are created by the database itself and therefore out of the test's scope. Usually this applies to primary keys assigned by sequence.
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - if

      • printTable

        void printTable(Table table,
              java.io.PrintStream printer)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Prints the table content to the given printer.

        This method is intended for debug purposes, if you really need to see, what Daleq has created for you.

        Parameters:
        table - the Table that should be printed to the printer.
        printer - a PrintStream, which receives the table.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred while writing to printer.
